categories.disk: Disk imaging, partition analysis, and storage forensics
categories.memory: RAM analysis, process extraction, and volatile data recovery
categories.network: Packet capture, traffic analysis, and network reconstructions
categories.logs: System logs, application logs, and event correlation
categories.registry: Windows Registry parsing and artifact extraction
categories.browser: Web history, cookies, cache, and browser artifact analysis
categories.mobile: iOS/Android forensics, app data, and mobile artifacts
categories.cloud: Cloud storage, SaaS forensics, and remote data analysis
categories.email: Email forensics, PST/MBOX parsing, and metadata analysis
categories.artifacts: OS artifacts, prefetch, shellbags, and timeline reconstruction
categories.hashing: File integrity, hash calculation, and verification
categories.timeline: Event correlation, super timelines, and chronological analysis
categories.recovery: Deleted file recovery, file carving, and data restoration
categories.dfir-suite: Comprehensive forensic platforms and automation tools

quick_reference.evidence_acquisition: Start with dd/ewfacquire for disk imaging, memdump for memory
quick_reference.initial_triage: Run volatility for memory, evtxdump for logs, netstat for live connections
quick_reference.timeline_creation: Use plaso/log2timeline to create super timelines from all artifacts
quick_reference.malware_detection: Scan with yara rules, analyze with volatility, check persistence in registry
quick_reference.data_recovery: Try photorec/scalpel for deleted files, check unallocated space
quick_reference.network_investigation: Capture with tcpdump, analyze with wireshark, extract files with zeek
quick_reference.windows_forensics: Parse registry (regripper), prefetch, event logs, shimcache
quick_reference.linux_forensics: Check /var/log/, bash_history, cron jobs, auth attempts
quick_reference.mobile_forensics: Use cellebrite/oxygen for full extraction, parse with ileapp/aleapp
